issues.description: The solution adds an extra attribute 'age' to Animal and provides a constructor Animal(String name, int age). The problem statement's UML and description only show a single attribute 'name' for Animal (and the example usage in the provided Main shows creating animals with a single String argument). This mismatch means students following the problem spec would implement constructors and subclasses with a single String parameter (name), while the solution requires an extra int parameter (age). This inconsistency can confuse students and cause tests or example code to be incompatible with the reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Either remove the 'age' attribute from the solution's Animal class (and change its constructor to Animal(String name)) and update all subclasses' constructors accordingly, or update the problem statement and UML to include the 'age' attribute and update the example usage in Main and the template to show two-argument constructors. The simplest fix to preserve the original exercise intent is to remove 'age' from the solution and use single-argument constructors (name) across Animal, Seal, Pig, and Goat.

issues.description: Subclasses in the solution (Seal, Pig, Goat) use constructors that require (String name, int age) but the problem statement examples and UML imply single-argument constructors (String name). This constructor parameter mismatch between problem/template expectations and the solution will prevent students from using the provided example code and may lead to failing tests expecting single-parameter constructors.
issues.suggested_fix: Align constructors across artifacts. If the exercise intends single-argument constructors, change the solution's subclass constructors to accept only (String name) and update calls to super(name). If the exercise intends to include age, update the problem statement, UML, and template Main to show and document two-argument constructors (String name, int age). Prefer keeping single-argument constructors to match the UML and example usage unless adding 'age' is an intentional extension (in which case update the problem text and template accordingly).
